page.title: 09THE BARLOW HUNT
page.content: The Barlow Hunt was formed and{hunts} in our area between{September}and{ {March}meeting every Tuesday and Thursday.The hunt consists of 60 pure bred foxhounds and is led by the master and the huntsman.The young foxhounds are bred and reared at{ {Horsleygate Hall Kennels}.The hounds are fed mainly on dead animals which are collected from the moors and mixed cereal.The hounds drink fresh spring water from the local hillside.To prevent them from worring the sheep while hunting,the young hounds of 1 year in age are placed in pens to accustom them to sheep.The hunt was formed in 1878 and since that time has had 3 masters from the same family.The hunt avoids damaging farmers crops and property and frighting the fox away from farmers poultry.The ages of the hunting foxhounds ranges from 2 to 7.
